description.narrative: Output 2.1: Federal, state and local governments have strengthened institutional capacity and systems (to formulate evidence- based plans, budget, coordinate, monitor and mobilize resources) for scaling up equitable WASH interventions.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.1: Federal, state and local governments have strengthened institutional capacity and systems (to formulate evidence- based plans, budget, coordinate, monitor and mobilize resources) for scaling up equitable WASH interventions.

description.narrative: UNICEF facilitated the institutionalization of the WASH NORM, contributed to the development of State WASH policies in Sokoto and Adamawa and local investment plans in 51 LGAs across 9 States, and supported the development of national guidelines. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of LGAs with fully functional routine mapping of WASH indicators
Water, sanitation and hygiene sector plans integrating climate resilient development and/or risk management strategies available
Number of states with Rural Water Supply and Sanitation agencies
Existence of water, sanitation and hygiene sector monitoring, evaluation and learning mechanism
